<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FINTECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/26/hotshot-fintech-startup-klarna-swings-first-ever-annual-loss?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Do You Believe in Klarna?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Swiping a credit card at a payment terminal " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTgyNzUzOTg4LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, hotshot Swedish fintech startup Klarna said <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/02/26/swedish-fintech-startup-klarna-reports-first-ever-annual-loss-in-2019.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">it suffered a $93 million loss</a> in 2019. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Why exactly is it news that a tech startup lost money?</strong> No, we aren’t getting kickbacks from Klarna’s competitors to lead with this story. It’s surprising because Klarna had been profitable every year since its 2005 founding. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Back to the beginning</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Klarna allows people to pay for online purchases in mostly interest-free, periodic installments (the "buy now, pay later" model). It generates revenue by charging retailers to use the service and by charging interest on late-paying customers. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Those retail partnerships have served the company well. Klarna is tied with banking app Revolut for Europe’s MVFS—most valuable fintech startup. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Klarna made about $11 million in profit in 2018 and processed close to half of Sweden’s online payments. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>It was valued at $5.5 billion last August after a $460 million fundraise. It’s backed by institutional heavyweights like Sequoia Capital and Snoop Dogg.</span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">So...what happened? </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Klarna got tired of functional public transportation and hopped the Atlantic. While it had been dabbling in the U.S. market since 2015, it really slammed the pedal down last year. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Klarna opened a pricey tech hub in Berlin and also ventured into Australia and New Zealand.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The company said </span><span><span>first-time users in new markets</span></span><span> were less reliable about making payments, which drove losses. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> Klarna CEO Sebastian Siemiatkowski <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/41adb97a-5870-11ea-a528-dd0f971febbc?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">suggested last year</a> that a public offering was on the horizon. Because that would likely happen in the U.S., it needs a solid foothold stateside before we drag the IPO tailgate equipment out of storage.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Klarna should be fine</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Its top line grew 31% in 2019, and it added 75,000 new merchants to its stable of <span>more than </span>200,000. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Plus, the volume of goods sold </span><span><span>through Klarna </span></span><span>jumped 32% to over $35 billion. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>No pain, no gain. Siemiatkowski told the FT last year he was laser-focused on growth. Looks like he spent some money to get there.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
INTERNATIONAL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/26/hong-kong-proposes-cash-payments-lighten-mood?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Hong Kong Tries to Lighten the Mood With $$$
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Hong Kong skyline" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTgyNzUwMDE5LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">To aid a population “overwhelmed by a heavy atmosphere,” Hong Kong’s government proposed a payment of HK$10,000 ($1,284) to every permanent city resident over 18. Your move, Andrew Yang.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The payment, which is part of an unusually bold <a href="https://www.aljazeera.com/ajimpact/hong-kong-boosts-budget-fight-virus-effectiveness-questioned-200226052914071.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">annual budget proposal</a>, is a desperate measure from a government that’s 1) confronting a record deficit and 2) trying to <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/hong-kong-hit-by-coronavirus-and-protests-to-hand-out-billions-in-cash-11582709863?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">resuscitate its economy</a>.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Coronavirus (HK confirmed case count yesterday: 89) has dead-legged retail and tourism spending.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>And last year’s widespread protests dented Hong Kong’s reputation as Asia’s busiest and largest financial center. HK’s economy contracted 1.2% in 2019 in its first annual recession since the financial crisis.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Jury’s still out on whether the payment will work, though. </strong>It <em>might</em> breathe life into the economy, if recipients spend the cash in HK and spend it quickly (two big ifs). One Natixis economist called the program “<a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-02-25/hong-kong-set-for-budget-deficit-amid-unrest-virus-outbreak?srnd=premium&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">untargeted and regressive</a>.”</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
EDUCATION
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/26/wharton-names-erika-james-new-dean?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Welcome to Wharton
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Erika James" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTgyODE2MjAwLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>The University of Pennsylvania</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">UPenn’s Wharton School has for decades been the premier destination for Brads and Chads looking to spend two years in Philly and never return. But now, it’s home to a new kind of leader.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Wharton <a href="https://penntoday.upenn.edu/news/erika-h-james-named-dean-penns-wharton-school?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">announced</a> that current Emory University business school head Erika James <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/wharton-names-first-female-dean-11582746974?mod=lead_feature_below_a_pos1&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">will take over</a> on July 1 as its next dean. She’ll be the first woman and first person of color to hold the post in Wharton’s 139 years.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Why it matters: </strong>As <a href="https://www.inquirer.com/business/wharton-dean-business-school-erika-james-geoff-garrett-20200226.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">the world’s first collegiate business school</a>, Wharton has earned its blue checkmark—you don’t see us making nearly as many jokes about b-schools like Fuqua or Tuck or Darden. So when Wharton makes an effort to practice what it teaches in MGMT 624: Leading Diversity in Organizations, other programs pay attention.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">James will have plenty on her to-do list.</strong> Applications to U.S. MBA programs have dropped for five straight years, and at Wharton, apps to its two-year MBA program declined about 5% last year. Because with a job market this good...you’d think twice about taking two years off to hang out at Smoke's.</p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
INVESTING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/26/subreddit-forum-gives-small-investors-outsized-impact?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Subreddit Moving Markets
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Image of Wall Street in front of New York Stock Exchange" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83MTU5L2ltYWdlX29mX3dhbGxfc3RyZWV0X2luX2Zyb250X29mX25ld195b3JrX3N0b2NrX2V4Y2hhbmdlLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Carlos Delgado, Wall Street - New York Stock Exchange, CC BY-SA 3.0</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Coronavirus isn’t the only wrinkle in the stock market this year. <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-02-26/reddit-s-profane-greedy-traders-are-shaking-up-the-stock-market?srnd=premium&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Bloomberg Businessweek reports</a> on r/wallstreetbets, the 900,000-user subreddit that’s likely behind recent head-scratching stock rallies from Virgin Galactic and fuel cell company Plug Power. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What’s happening: </strong>Chatty traders have used the Reddit forum to take advantage of options contracts—trades that allow you to bet on a stock rising or falling without actually buying the underlying shares. /WSB users have tried to push up individual stock prices by buying bullish options contracts known as “calls.”</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>And they’re actually moving the needle. For some stocks, bullish options bets have outnumbered bearish ones—that’s not normally how the options market works.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Flashback: </strong>Something similar was happening in chat rooms in the late 1990s, when day traders would hype up stocks through message boards. Of course, those Gen X-ers didn’t have to worry about nosy algorithms combing the internet for market-moving information. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>/WSB shows small investors are putting their stamp on the stock market.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
C-SUITE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/26/csuite-leaders-cant-quite-nail-baseball-references?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
How to Become a Corporate Exec: Batting Practice
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Baseball player sliding into base GIF" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=377 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/3o7TKIER8JO6AroICI/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Baseball player sliding into base GIF" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/3o7TKIER8JO6AroICI/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Forget 30 years of experience and an MBA—the most direct path to the c-suite is talking more like Kenny Powers. The WSJ’s Telis Demos found that analysts often ask execs “What inning are you in?” on conference calls to gauge progress. And then he <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/take-me-out-to-the-conference-call-11582655315?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">rounded up the best quotes</a>.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>When asked this month about cloud adoption rates, Amazon Web Services CEO and little league third base coach Andrew Jassy replied, “I would say that maybe two outs, bottom of the first, runner is on board. Runs in on both sides, though.”</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Don’t ask Union Pacific COO Jim Vena about baseball when it’s football season. In January he said, “I started on the 20-yard line, 25-yard line, and I don’t think I’ve hit the middle of the field yet” about the company’s precision scheduling. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>David Gitlin, CEO of Carrier in February: “Even though Willis Carrier invented modern air conditioning in 1902, we’re viewing this as the first inning.”</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>But always remember to do your research before asking a sports question. On Tuesday, JPMorgan Chase’s COO wondered aloud, “How many innings are there anyway?” He was born in Britain.</span></li>
</ul>

He appointed Vice President Mike Pence to lead the U.S. response.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHousing: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eU.S. new home sales \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/60f18c0bd4bf4236919aad7454aed098?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erose 7.9%\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e in January, the fastest pace since before the recession. The median price of a new house in America was $348,200.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003c!-- END MARKETS --\u003e\n\u003c!-- ARTICLE ---\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"c6 \" style=\"margin-bottom:7px\"\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003cth class=\"card\" style=\"text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px\"\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding: 15px;\"\u003e\n\u003ch3 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nFINTECH \n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/26/hotshot-fintech-startup-klarna-swings-first-ever-annual-loss?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nDo You Believe in Klarna?\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Swiping a credit card at a payment terminal \" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTgyNzUzOTg4LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, hotshot Swedish fintech startup Klarna said \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/02/26/swedish-fintech-startup-klarna-reports-first-ever-annual-loss-in-2019.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eit suffered a $93 million loss\u003c/a\u003e in 2019. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhy exactly is it news that a tech startup lost money?\u003c/strong\u003e No, we aren’t getting kickbacks from Klarna’s competitors to lead with this story. It’s surprising because Klarna had been profitable every year since its 2005 founding. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eBack to the beginning\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eKlarna allows people to pay for online purchases in mostly interest-free, periodic installments (the \"buy now, pay later\" model). It generates revenue by charging retailers to use the service and by charging interest on late-paying customers. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThose retail partnerships have served the company well. Klarna is tied with banking app Revolut for Europe’s MVFS—most valuable fintech startup. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eKlarna made about $11 million in profit in 2018 and processed close to half of Sweden’s online payments. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIt was valued at $5.5 billion last August after a $460 million fundraise. It’s backed by institutional heavyweights like Sequoia Capital and Snoop Dogg.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eSo...what happened? \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eKlarna got tired of functional public transportation and hopped the Atlantic. While it had been dabbling in the U.S. market since 2015, it really slammed the pedal down last year. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eKlarna opened a pricey tech hub in Berlin and also ventured into Australia and New Zealand.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe company said \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cspan\u003efirst-time users in new markets\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e were less reliable about making payments, which drove losses. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out:\u003c/strong\u003e Klarna CEO Sebastian Siemiatkowski \u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/41adb97a-5870-11ea-a528-dd0f971febbc?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esuggested last year\u003c/a\u003e that a public offering was on the horizon. Because that would likely happen in the U.S., it needs a solid foothold stateside before we drag the IPO tailgate equipment out of storage.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eKlarna should be fine\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIts top line grew 31% in 2019, and it added 75,000 new merchants to its stable of \u003cspan\u003emore than \u003c/span\u003e200,000. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003ePlus, the volume of goods sold \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cspan\u003ethrough Klarna \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003ejumped 32% to over $35 billion. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eNo pain, no gain. Siemiatkowski told the FT last year he was laser-focused on growth. Looks like he spent some money to get there.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTo aid a population “overwhelmed by a heavy atmosphere,” Hong Kong’s government proposed a payment of HK$10,000 ($1,284) to every permanent city resident over 18. Your move, Andrew Yang.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe payment, which is part of an unusually bold \u003ca href=\"https://www.aljazeera.com/ajimpact/hong-kong-boosts-budget-fight-virus-effectiveness-questioned-200226052914071.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eannual budget proposal\u003c/a\u003e, is a desperate measure from a government that’s 1) confronting a record deficit and 2) trying to \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/hong-kong-hit-by-coronavirus-and-protests-to-hand-out-billions-in-cash-11582709863?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eresuscitate its economy\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eCoronavirus (HK confirmed case count yesterday: 89) has dead-legged retail and tourism spending.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAnd last year’s widespread protests dented Hong Kong’s reputation as Asia’s busiest and largest financial center. HK’s economy contracted 1.2% in 2019 in its first annual recession since the financial crisis.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eJury’s still out on whether the payment will work, though. \u003c/strong\u003eIt \u003cem\u003emight\u003c/em\u003e breathe life into the economy, if recipients spend the cash in HK and spend it quickly (two big ifs). One Natixis economist called the program “\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-02-25/hong-kong-set-for-budget-deficit-amid-unrest-virus-outbreak?srnd=premium\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003euntargeted and regressive\u003c/a\u003e.”\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-top: 12px;\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2020%2F02%2F26%2Fhong-kong-proposes-cash-payments-lighten-mood\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none;\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"\" style=\"display: inline-block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTgyODE2MjAwLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eThe University of Pennsylvania\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eUPenn’s Wharton School has for decades been the premier destination for Brads and Chads looking to spend two years in Philly and never return. But now, it’s home to a new kind of leader.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWharton \u003ca href=\"https://penntoday.upenn.edu/news/erika-h-james-named-dean-penns-wharton-school?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eannounced\u003c/a\u003e that current Emory University business school head Erika James \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/wharton-names-first-female-dean-11582746974?mod=lead_feature_below_a_pos1\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewill take over\u003c/a\u003e on July 1 as its next dean. She’ll be the first woman and first person of color to hold the post in Wharton’s 139 years.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhy it matters: \u003c/strong\u003eAs \u003ca href=\"https://www.inquirer.com/business/wharton-dean-business-school-erika-james-geoff-garrett-20200226.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ethe world’s first collegiate business school\u003c/a\u003e, Wharton has earned its blue checkmark—you don’t see us making nearly as many jokes about b-schools like Fuqua or Tuck or Darden. So when Wharton makes an effort to practice what it teaches in MGMT 624: Leading Diversity in Organizations, other programs pay attention.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eJames will have plenty on her to-do list.\u003c/strong\u003e Applications to U.S. MBA programs have dropped for five straight years, and at Wharton, apps to its two-year MBA program declined about 5% last year. Because with a job market this good...you’d think twice about taking two years off to hang out at Smoke's.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eCoronavirus isn’t the only wrinkle in the stock market this year. \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-02-26/reddit-s-profane-greedy-traders-are-shaking-up-the-stock-market?srnd=premium\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eBloomberg Businessweek reports\u003c/a\u003e on r/wallstreetbets, the 900,000-user subreddit that’s likely behind recent head-scratching stock rallies from Virgin Galactic and fuel cell company Plug Power. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat’s happening: \u003c/strong\u003eChatty traders have used the Reddit forum to take advantage of options contracts—trades that allow you to bet on a stock rising or falling without actually buying the underlying shares. /WSB users have tried to push up individual stock prices by buying bullish options contracts known as “calls.”\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAnd they’re actually moving the needle. For some stocks, bullish options bets have outnumbered bearish ones—that’s not normally how the options market works.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eFlashback: \u003c/strong\u003eSomething similar was happening in chat rooms in the late 1990s, when day traders would hype up stocks through message boards. Of course, those Gen X-ers didn’t have to worry about nosy algorithms combing the internet for market-moving information. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eForget 30 years of experience and an MBA—the most direct path to the c-suite is talking more like Kenny Powers. The WSJ’s Telis Demos found that analysts often ask execs “What inning are you in?” on conference calls to gauge progress. And then he \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/take-me-out-to-the-conference-call-11582655315?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erounded up the best quotes\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWhen asked this month about cloud adoption rates, Amazon Web Services CEO and little league third base coach Andrew Jassy replied, “I would say that maybe two outs, bottom of the first, runner is on board. Runs in on both sides, though.”\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eDon’t ask Union Pacific COO Jim Vena about baseball when it’s football season. In January he said, “I started on the 20-yard line, 25-yard line, and I don’t think I’ve hit the middle of the field yet” about the company’s precision scheduling. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eDavid Gitlin, CEO of Carrier in February: “Even though Willis Carrier invented modern air conditioning in 1902, we’re viewing this as the first inning.”\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBut always remember to do your research before asking a sports question. On Tuesday, JPMorgan Chase’s COO wondered aloud, “How many innings are there anyway?” He was born in Britain.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS
